results.title: All about Bobby
results.creator_credit: Brad Stanley and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: Clearly, no one knows about twelve-year-old Bobby Ramirez, although each person questioned has their own opinion and impression of the boy. All of those impressions, and others are voice over film clips which show him going about his regular activities and refuting right and left views of the people who think they know him. A stimulating film which leads to an investigation into what and who each of us is.

results.title: Alimentary tract
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Intended as a supplement to Digestion of foods, this film treats in detail, motility phenomena of the gastro-intestinal tract. Actual photography reveals different types of movements in the stomach, such as hypermotility, inhibition, antiperistalsis, hunger contractions and normal movements.

results.title: Alice through the lift door: the other side of shopping
results.brief_description: A brief history of the various types of stores in Australia from the early market days to the present day large department store and shopping centre complexes. The behind the scenes operations of a department store are described.

results.title: Alice Springs: red heart blue centre
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alice Springs is viewed here in its natural environment of desert landscape, ringed by distant ranges and Ayers Rock and as a busy township with its regular services, activities and recreations. From varied shots of its people and activities the camera frequently returns to the countryside around and shows close-up shots of its plant life. No spoken commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia

results.title: Alice Elliott
results.brief_description: The Promo Indians are among the world’s finest basket-makers. Alice Elliott is one of a few Promo continuing this centuries-old tradition.

results.title: Ali and his baby camel
results.brief_description: The relationship between a little boy in the Middle East and his pet camel. Designed to introduce small children to the idea of caring properly for pets, to show the camel as both a pet and essential part of the desert community, and to show animals and humans adapt to their environment.

results.title: Algerian pipeline
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Humphrey Swingler, British Information Services and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: The ever-increasing output of Algeria’s oilfields demanded a new pipeline outlet to the Mediterranean. The sponsors were awarded a 25 million pound contract to design and construct a complete pipeline installation within the short time of 18 months. This film describes how a 500-mile pipeline was constructed from the Sahara across the Atlas Mountains to Arzew. The building of pump stations, departure and arrival terminals, submarine loading lines, ancillary works and the training of Algerian personnel are also covered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Williams, Humphrey Swingler, British Information Services and Greenpark Productions

results.title: Alexander Nevsky [study extract]
results.brief_description: One of a series of short extracts from feature films intended for study of cinema technique. During the 13th century, Russia was endangered by the invasion of Teutonic Knights, the founders of Prussia. Under the leadership of Prince Alexander Nevsky, the Russians unite and counter the German onslaught on the ice of Lake Peipus and defeat them. The commencement of the battle is the subject of the excerpt. At first Nevsky and his aides are seen on a high rock - the camera intercutting faces on the waiting soldiers and the preparation of the enemy camp. The Germans begin to advance, gathering speed. Battle is joined.

results.title: Alert!
results.brief_description: A series of incidents demonstrating the need for accident prevention. People on dangerous jobs are aware of the risks and keep their minds on their work, but passers-by and workers who are worried or inclined to day-dream, need to remember that nearly all accidents happen through thinking of something else. A quarter of all accidents happen through the job being done the wrong way; untidily, without safety devices or too fast. Film closes by re-emphasising the need to be constantly alert.

results.title: Alcoholism: who gets hurt?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Questions, Answers.”.
Shows the problems of a son of an alcoholic as he vacillates between shielding his father and trying to find his own place among his peers. Uses an extract from the Disney production “Follow me boys” made in 1966.
